# Altitude Associated Changes in ant Morphology and Genus-dependent Resource Preference in Guadarrama Ants"

Ant Morphology Analysis

Our study took place in the Guadarra Mountains of Spain. Scientist measured the size of the different morphological structures of a multitude of ant taxa across varying altitudes and regions of Guadarra mountain range as well as the resources ants were observed using. We aim to analyze how the size of the measured morphological features varies with altitude as well as to understand a genus-specific preference for certain resource types across ant taxa. 

The data sets we used can be found here: 
https://doi.org/10.6084/m9.figshare.14596065.v1 ('Ant_traits_in_central_Spain')
https://doi.org/10.6084/m9.figshare.13246619.v1 ('AntsInGuadarrama')


::: {.cell}

## HYPOTHESIS 1 


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Import Data + Create Dataframes

Ant = read.csv("Ant_traits_in_central_Spain.csv", header = TRUE) #Importing data set into R from local device for Hypothesis 1 

# Result: Data in R environment, ready to be manipulated and tested for statistical significance 
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Data Summary Calculations

head_mean = mean(Ant$head) #Create data frame for the mean size of ant head
print(head_mean) #Output the value in 'head_mean', the mean size of the head
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] NA
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
leg_mean = mean(Ant$leg) #Create data frame for the mean size of ant leg
print(leg_mean) #Output the value in 'leg_mean', the mean size of the leg
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] NA
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
scape_mean = mean(Ant$scape) #Create data frame for the mean size of ant scape
print(scape_mean) #Output the value in 'scape_mean', the mean size of the scape
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] NA
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
eye_mean = mean(Ant$scape) #Create data frame for the mean size of ant eye
print(eye_mean) #Output the value in 'eye_mean', the mean size of the eye
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] NA
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Test for Statistical Significance (Linear Model)

mod_head = lm(head ~ altitude, data = Ant) #Creation of a linear model calculations for head measurements in relation to altitude
summary(mod_head) #Displaying the results of the linear model calculation 
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

Call:
lm(formula = head ~ altitude, data = Ant)

Residuals:
     Min       1Q   Median       3Q      Max 
-0.75324 -0.29602 -0.04399  0.22126  2.37833 

Coefficients:
              Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    
(Intercept)  1.187e+00  3.613e-02  32.863  < 2e-16 ***
altitude    -1.252e-04  2.663e-05  -4.701 2.92e-06 ***
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

Residual standard error: 0.4098 on 1064 degrees of freedom
  (13 observations deleted due to missingness)
Multiple R-squared:  0.02035,	Adjusted R-squared:  0.01943 
F-statistic:  22.1 on 1 and 1064 DF,  p-value: 2.925e-06
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
mod_leg = lm(leg ~ altitude, data = Ant) #Creation of a linear model calculations for leg measurements in relation to altitude
summary(mod_leg) #Displaying the results of the linear model calculation 
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

Call:
lm(formula = leg ~ altitude, data = Ant)

Residuals:
    Min      1Q  Median      3Q     Max 
-1.0824 -0.5439 -0.1428  0.5350  2.5360 

Coefficients:
              Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    
(Intercept)  1.486e+00  5.796e-02  25.646  < 2e-16 ***
altitude    -2.368e-04  4.271e-05  -5.543 3.74e-08 ***
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

Residual standard error: 0.6574 on 1064 degrees of freedom
  (13 observations deleted due to missingness)
Multiple R-squared:  0.02807,	Adjusted R-squared:  0.02716 
F-statistic: 30.73 on 1 and 1064 DF,  p-value: 3.743e-08
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
mod_scape = lm(scape~ altitude, data = Ant) #Creation of a linear model calculations for scape measurements in relation to altitude
summary(mod_scape) #Displaying the results of the linear model calculation 
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

Call:
lm(formula = scape ~ altitude, data = Ant)

Residuals:
     Min       1Q   Median       3Q      Max 
-0.84836 -0.40154 -0.08094  0.40349  2.33945 

Coefficients:
              Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    
(Intercept)  1.324e+00  4.402e-02  30.087  < 2e-16 ***
altitude    -2.205e-04  3.244e-05  -6.796 1.78e-11 ***
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

Residual standard error: 0.4993 on 1064 degrees of freedom
  (13 observations deleted due to missingness)
Multiple R-squared:  0.04161,	Adjusted R-squared:  0.04071 
F-statistic: 46.19 on 1 and 1064 DF,  p-value: 1.783e-11
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
mod_eye = lm(eye~ altitude, data = Ant) #Creation of a linear model calculations for eye measurements in relation to altitude
summary(mod_eye) #Displaying the results of the linear model calculation 
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

Call:
lm(formula = eye ~ altitude, data = Ant)

Residuals:
     Min       1Q   Median       3Q      Max 
-0.18512 -0.07062 -0.01803  0.06336  0.40555 

Coefficients:
              Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    
(Intercept)  2.343e-01  8.131e-03  28.814  < 2e-16 ***
altitude    -2.227e-05  5.992e-06  -3.716 0.000213 ***
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

Residual standard error: 0.09223 on 1064 degrees of freedom
  (13 observations deleted due to missingness)
Multiple R-squared:  0.01281,	Adjusted R-squared:  0.01189 
F-statistic: 13.81 on 1 and 1064 DF,  p-value: 0.0002126
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Result: All morphological features analyzed had a statistically significant relation to altitude (p-value < 0.05)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Figure Creation (Linear Regression)

# Linear regression figure for eye size 
ggplot(Ant,aes(x=altitude, y=eye)) + 
  geom_point() + 
  theme_classic() + #Change theme  for aesthetics 
  geom_smooth(method="lm") + 
  labs(x='Altitude (in meters)', y='Logged Eye Size')
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'
```
:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Warning: Removed 13 rows containing non-finite values (`stat_smooth()`).
```
:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Warning: Removed 13 rows containing missing values (`geom_point()`).
```
:::
